articles.title: Greenland Declares Emergency After Orcas Spotted Near Melting Ice Shelves
articles.description: Researchers have spotted orcas breaching dangerously close to rapidly melting ice shelves, prompting emergency measures in Greenland.

articles.title: A North Atlantic Right Whale Baby Boom Is On, But the Species Remains at Risk
articles.description: North Atlantic right whales are experiencing an encouraging uptick in births, but conservationists warn the critically endangered species still faces significant threats.

articles.title: Aquariums Save Beluga Whales from Threat of Euthanasia
articles.description: Several aquariums have stepped in to rescue beluga whales that were facing potential euthanasia, providing them new homes and care.

articles.title: 44-Year-Old Whale 'Slalom' Breaks Record with Seventh Calf
articles.description: A 44-year-old whale nicknamed 'Slalom' has given birth to her seventh calf, breaking a 15-year record for the species.
